Trailer Of Salman Khan’s Bharat Is Out & It Has Already Sent The Internet On A Trolling Spree!
After the Race 3 debacle, Salman Khan is back on the big screen with Bharat – a movie in which he is playing a character whose journey will unfold over several years.
It’s a period drama and the trailer opens with Jawaharlal Nehru's Tryst with Destiny speech. Salman’s character lives a journey which is no less than a roller coaster ride. And so, we get to see different shades of his character.
From a motorcycle stuntman to an oil-mining employee, from fighting off pirates as a navy officer to saving co-workers from blasts dust storms and locating missing immigrants from across the border, Salman's character journey’s through 71 years of Indian history.
Without further ado, watch Bharat trailer below.

Bharat is a remake of Korean movie titled Ode To My Father, which is a story about a man separated from his father during war, desperately longs to reunite with him and his missing sister. This will be Salman Khan’s third collaboration with Ali Abbas Zafar after Sultan and Tiger Zinda Hai.
The Korean film – Ode To My Father – was a classic hit. Will Bharat live up to the expectations? Only time will tell. Also starring Tabu, Disha Patani and Jackie Shroff, Bharat is scheduled to hit the screens on June 5 (of course around Eid).
